abstract: In a document filed with the Securities Exchange Commission, the media giant pushed back against the assessment of an investor advisory company, which said its board had shown a "striking lack of stewardship'' related to the phone-hacking scandal in Britain.
snippet: In a document filed with the Securities Exchange Commission, the media giant pushed back against the assessment of an investor advisory company, which said its board had shown a "striking lack of stewardship'' related to the phone-hacking scandal in...
lead_paragraph: News Corporation went on the defensive Tuesday morning after an investor advisory firm urged shareholders to vote against reinstating several key members of the media giant's board of directors, including the chairman and chief executive, Rupert Murdoch, and his son James Murdoch.

headline.main: News Corp. Filing Rebuts Criticism of Board
